text: When Academy Rector dies, you may exile it. If you do, search your library for an enchantment card, put that card onto the battlefield, then shuffle your library.
originalText: When Academy Rector is put into a graveyard from play, you may remove Academy Rector from the game. If you do, search your library for an enchantment card and put that card into play. Then shuffle your library.
name: Academy Rector

rulings.text: You do not have to find an enchantment card if you do not want to, even if you have one in your library.
An enchantment card is any Enchantment card, including Auras.

name: Æther Sting

rulings.text: The ability triggers when an opponent casts a creature spell, and goes on the stack above that spell. As such, the ability will deal 1 damage to that player before the creature enters the battlefield.

text: Whenever an opponent casts a creature spell, Æther Sting deals 1 damage to that player.
originalText: Whenever one of your opponents plays a creature spell, Æther Sting deals 1 damage to that player.
flavor: When Gatha fell, he was called to account for each abomination he created.

text: {G}: Regenerate Ancient Silverback. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
flavor: The Phyrexian killing machines couldn't have known the seriousness of their mistake in wounding the ape—they'd never seen it angry.

foreignNames.name: 年経たシルバーバック

originalText: {G} Regenerate Ancient Silverback.
name: Ancient Silverback
Apprentice Necromancer
text: {B}, {T}, Sacrifice Apprentice Necromancer: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield. That creature gains haste. At the beginning of the next end step, sacrifice it.
originalText: {B}, {T}, Sacrifice Apprentice Necromancer: Return target creature card from your graveyard to play. That creature gains haste. At end of turn, sacrifice it. (The creature may attack and {T} the turn it comes under your control.)

name: Archery Training

rulings.text: If there is more than one Archery Training on a creature, each granted ability counts the counters on the Archery Training that granted that ability.
You do not remove counters when using the ability.
Putting on a counter is optional. If you forget, you can't go back later even if it is something you usually do.

text:
Enchant creature
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put an arrow counter on Archery Training.
Enchanted creature has "{T}: This creature deals X damage to target attacking or blocking creature, where X is the number of arrow counters on Archery Training."
originalText:
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put an arrow counter on Archery Training.
Enchanted creature gains "{T}: This creature deals X damage to target attacking or blocking creature, where X is the number of arrow counters on the Archery Training enchanting this creature."

name: Attrition
text: {B}, Sacrifice a creature: Destroy target nonblack creature.
originalText: {B}, Sacrifice a creature: Destroy target nonblack creature.
flavor:
"I will trade life for life with the insurgents. Our resources, unlike theirs, are limitless."
—Davvol, Evincar of Rath

text:
Flying
When Aura Thief dies, you gain control of all enchantments. (You don't get to move Auras.)
flavor: Illusion steals reality from the unwise.
originalText:
Flying
When Aura Thief is put into a graveyard from play, you gain control of all enchantments. (You don't get to move local enchantments.)
name: Aura Thief

rulings.text: Gaining control of an enchantment often isn't very interesting since it probably won't change what the enchantment is doing. It only matters if the enchantment does something specifically to "you" or "an opponent" or if the enchantment has an activated ability (which only the controller can use).

text:
Flying
{3}{U}: Untap Blizzard Elemental.
flavor: Students who had seen Rayne argue with Urza were certain she had summoned it to make him seem warmer by comparison.
originalText:
Flying
{3}{U} Untap Blizzard Elemental.
name: Blizzard Elemental

text: {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Bloodshot Cyclops deals damage equal to the sacrificed creature's power to target creature or player.
flavor: After their first encounter, the goblins named him Chuck.
originalText: {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Bloodshot Cyclops deals X damage to target creature or player, where X is the sacrificed creature's power.
name: Bloodshot Cyclops

text:
When Body Snatcher enters the battlefield, exile it unless you discard a creature card.
When Body Snatcher dies, exile Body Snatcher and return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
originalText:
When Body Snatcher comes into play, you may choose and discard a creature card from your hand. If you don't, remove Body Snatcher from the game.
When Body Snatcher is put into a graveyard from play, remove Body Snatcher from the game and return target creature card from your graveyard to play.
name: Body Snatcher

rulings.text: You choose whether or not to discard on resolution.
You can choose to target itself to return to the battlefield, but the exiling happens first and so the return will fail.

name: Braidwood Cup
text: {T}: You gain 1 life.
originalText: {T}: You gain 1 life.
flavor:
"I think it no accident that every civilized people has discovered the art of distillation."
—Rofellos of Llanowar

name: Braidwood Sextant

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

text: {2}, {T}, Sacrifice Braidwood Sextant: Search your library for a basic land card, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
originalText: {2}, {T}, Sacrifice Braidwood Sextant: Search your library for a basic land card, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

name: Brass Secretary
text: {2}, Sacrifice Brass Secretary: Draw a card.
originalText: {2}, Sacrifice Brass Secretary: Draw a card.
flavor: The students disliked the secretary for its unfailing memory—until they discovered it couldn't dodge thrown objects.

originalText: Bubbling Beebles is unblockable as long as defending player controls an enchantment.

Bubbling Muck

rulings.text: Affects lands with type Swamp, not lands that are named "Swamp."
Affects lands tapped for rest of turn, not just swamps on the battlefield at the time it resolves. This is because it affects players and not the lands themselves.

text: Until end of turn, whenever a player taps a Swamp for mana, that player adds {B} to his or her mana pool (in addition to the mana the land produces).
originalText: Until end of turn, whenever a player taps a swamp for mana, it produces an additional {B}.
flavor: The muck claims a hundred living things for each meager treasure it spews forth.

name: Caltrops
text: Whenever a creature attacks, Caltrops deals 1 damage to it.
originalText: Whenever a creature attacks, Caltrops deals 1 damage to it.
flavor: Toward the end, Gatha struggled to keep his experiments in and his patrons out.

text:
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)

{1}{W} Capashen Knight gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

text: {W}: Capashen Templar gets +0/+1 until end of turn.

rulings.text: This is not optional.

text: Whenever a creature enters the battlefield, you lose 1 life and add {B} to your mana pool.
originalText: Whenever a creature comes into play, you lose 1 life and add {B} to your mana pool.

name: Chime of Night
text:
Enchant creature
When Chime of Night is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, destroy target nonblack creature.
originalText: When Chime of Night is put into a graveyard from play, destroy target nonblack creature.
flavor: Many sent to serve Davvol carried such instruments, as if to remind him who their true masters were.

Compost

rulings.text: The ability triggers on a black card being discarded, milled, or countered, as well as a black card going to the graveyard from the battlefield.

text: Whenever a black card is put into an opponent's graveyard from anywhere, you may draw a card.
originalText: Whenever a black card is put into one of your opponents' graveyards, you may draw a card.
flavor:
A fruit must rot before its seed can sprout.
—Yavimaya saying

text:
Flying
When you control no artifacts, sacrifice Covetous Dragon.
flavor: Gatha survived as long as he did by giving all Keld's predators exactly what they wanted.
originalText:
Flying
When you control no artifacts, sacrifice Covetous Dragon.
name: Covetous Dragon

rulings.text: The ability will trigger if you don't control an artifact, even for a brief moment during the resolution of another spell or ability.
The ability only checks if you control no artifacts at the time it triggers. It does not check again on resolution. So gaining control of an artifact before then will not save the Dragon.

name: Disappear
text:
Enchant creature
{U}: Return enchanted creature and Disappear to their owners' hands.
originalText: {U} Return enchanted creature and Disappear to their owners' hands.
flavor: If at first you don't succeed, run away and hide.

text: When Disease Carriers dies, target creature gets -2/-2 until end of turn.

Donate

rulings.text: If you Donate an Aura, it stays where it is, but the targeted player now controls it.

text: Target player gains control of target permanent you control.
originalText: Target player gains control of target permanent you control.
flavor: Campus pranksters initiate new students with the old "beeble bomb" routine.

name: Dying Wail

rulings.text: If they have less than 2 cards, they discard all the cards they have.
It only triggers on a creature going to the graveyard from the battlefield.

text:
Enchant creature
When enchanted creature dies, target player discards two cards.
originalText: When enchanted creature is put into a graveyard from play, target player chooses and discards two cards from his or her hand.
flavor: This is a world of spiteful wasps that sting and kill even as they die.

text: Shroud (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
flavor: Like a masterful quilter, Yavimaya stitches together patches of color to warn its denizens of threats.
originalText: Elvish Lookout can't be the target of spells or abilities.
name: Elvish Lookout

text: {G}, {T}: You may put a creature card from your hand onto the battlefield.
flavor:
From Gaea grew the world, and the world was silent. From Gaea grew the world's elves, and the world was silent no more.
—Elvish teaching
originalText: {G}, {T}: Put a creature card from your hand into play.
name: Elvish Piper

rulings.text: Putting the card onto the battlefield is optional. When the ability resolves, you can choose not to.
A "creature card" is any card with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact, Enchantment, or Land. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature cards.

text: When you control no other creatures, sacrifice Emperor Crocodile.
flavor: The king of Yavimaya's waters pays constant attention to his subjects . . . and thrives on their adulation.
originalText: When you control no other creatures, sacrifice Emperor Crocodile.
name: Emperor Crocodile

rulings.text: The ability will trigger if you don't control another creature, even for a brief moment during the resolution of another spell or ability.
Only checks if you control no other creatures at the time it triggers. It does not check again on resolution, so gaining control of a creature before then will not save the Crocodile.

name: Encroach

rulings.text: You choose a land card that is not a basic land.
If you target yourself with this spell, you must reveal your entire hand to the other players just as any other player would.

text: Target player reveals his or her hand. You choose a nonbasic land card from it. That player discards that card.
originalText: Look at target player's hand and choose a nonbasic land card from it. That player discards that card.
flavor:
"The rate of spread in this region is unacceptable. Start again."
—Davvol, Evincar of Rath

name: Eradicate

rulings.text: Use the name of the card as it leaves the battlefield.

If a copy card is targeted by this effect, you get to look for another copy of the card it is copying. This is because a copy card actually takes on the name and initial characteristics of what it copies.
Does not exile other cards of the same name that are on the battlefield. Just from the graveyard, hand, and library.

If you manage to turn a land (such as a Forest or Stalking Stones) into a creature, you can indeed use this effect on that basic land type. Eradicate's exile effect only looks for cards by name, not type.
The copies must be found if they are in publicly viewable zones. Finding copies while searching private zones is optional.

A face-down creature has no name, so no card can possibly share a name with it (not even other cards with no name). If you Eradicate a face-down creature you will still search its controller's library, but you won't be able to exile any cards from that library.

text: Exile target nonblack creature. Search its controller's graveyard, hand, and library for all cards with the same name as that creature and exile them. Then that player shuffles his or her library.
originalText: Remove target nonblack creature from the game. Search its controller's graveyard, hand, and library for all copies of that card and remove them from the game. That player then shuffles his or her library.

text:
Echo {4} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
Sacrifice an artifact: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
flavor: As the invasion drew closer, Urza's means began to resemble Phyrexia's end.
originalText:
Echo
Sacrifice an artifact: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
name: Extruder

rulings.text: It can choose itself as the target, but it will be countered when it tries to resolve since it will no longer be on the battlefield. This is useful only when you want to simply destroy this card.

text: When False Prophet dies, exile all creatures.
flavor: "You lived for Serra's love. Will you not die for it?"
originalText: When False Prophet is put into a graveyard from play, remove all creatures from the game.
name: False Prophet

rulings.text: False Prophet only exiles creatures, which means only creature permanents which are on the battlefield. It won't exile itself since it is already in the graveyard.

name: Fatigue
text: Target player skips his or her next draw step.
originalText: Target player skips his or her next draw step.
flavor: "Mind if I just lie down right here for a few weeks?"

name: Fend Off

rulings.text: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

text:
Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt by target creature this turn.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
originalText:
Cycling {2}
Target creature deals no combat damage this turn.
flavor: The best defense is to not get hit.

name: Festering Wound

rulings.text: If it is on your creature, you can decide whether to add a counter before or after it damages you.
Putting on a counter is optional. If you forget, you can't go back later even if it is something you usually do.

text:
Enchant creature
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put an infection counter on Festering Wound.
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted creature's controller, Festering Wound deals X damage to that player, where X is the number of infection counters on Festering Wound.
originalText:
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put an infection counter on Festering Wound.
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted creature's controller, Festering Wound deals X damage to that player, where X is the number of infection counters on Festering Wound.

text: Tap an untapped creature you control: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature this turn.

originalText: Tap an untapped creature you control: Prevent the next 1 damage to target creature this turn.

Flame Jet

rulings.text: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

text:
Flame Jet deals 3 damage to target player.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
originalText:
Cycling {2}
Flame Jet deals 3 damage to target player.
flavor: Did the land make the Keldons? Did the Keldons make the land? Or were they simply meant for each other?

text: Fledgling Osprey has flying as long as it's enchanted.
flavor: It isn't truly born until its first flight.
originalText: Fledgling Osprey gains flying as long as it's enchanted.
name: Fledgling Osprey
Flicker

rulings.text: It will trigger "enters the battlefield" abilities and "leaves the battlefield" abilities. Note that the card does not go to the graveyard, so it will not trigger "goes to the graveyard" abilities.

This could be used to make the target of another spell or ability illegal if this wasn't a sorcery (which makes it really hard to do that). This is because the Flickered permanent leaves the battlefield and then returns as a completely different permanent, and the targeted spell will not recognize it.

This spell effectively "resets" the permanent to being just like it was freshly cast. All counters, Auras, effects, and so on are removed when it is exiled. Then it comes back onto the battlefield like new.

text: Exile target nontoken permanent, then return it to the battlefield under its owner's control.
originalText: Remove target nontoken permanent from the game, then return it to play under its owner's control.
flavor: Who is truer: you who are, or you who are to be?

name: Fodder Cannon
text: {4}, {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Fodder Cannon deals 4 damage to target creature.
originalText: {4}, {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Fodder Cannon deals 4 damage to target creature.
flavor:
Step 1: Find your cousin.
Step 2: Get your cousin in the cannon.
Step 3: Find another cousin.

text: When Gamekeeper dies, you may exile it. If you do, reveal cards from the top of your library until you reveal a creature card. Put that card onto the battlefield and put all other cards revealed this way into your graveyard.
originalText: When Gamekeeper is put into a graveyard from play, you may remove Gamekeeper from the game. If you do, reveal cards from your library until you reveal a creature card. Put that card into play and put the other cards revealed this way into your graveyard.
name: Gamekeeper

rulings.text: If you have no creature cards in your library, all the cards from your library end up in your graveyard and you do not get to put a creature onto the battlefield.
Exiling this card is optional. If you forget to do so, you can't go back later and do so, even if that is what you normally do.

text: First strike, haste

originalText: First strike; haste (This creature may attack and {T} the turn it comes under your control.)
name: Goblin Berserker
Goblin Festival

rulings.text: If you activate this multiple times in a row so the stack has more than one of this ability on it, the abilities will still resolve even if Goblin Festival leaves the battlefield or leaves your control before they resolve. For example, if activate the ability twice, and after the first flip you lose control of it because you lost the toss, or it leaves the battlefield, then you still flip for the second ability.

The controller of the ability chooses one of his or her opponents. If this card changes controllers before the ability resolves, you still pick an opponent of the player who controlled it when it was activated.

text: {2}: Goblin Festival deals 1 damage to target creature or player. Flip a coin. If you lose the flip, choose one of your opponents. That player gains control of Goblin Festival.
originalText: {2}: Goblin Festival deals 1 damage to target creature or player. Flip a coin. If you lose the flip, choose one of your opponents. That player gains control of Goblin Festival.

originalText: When Goblin Gardener is put into a graveyard from play, destroy target land.

text: Sacrifice any number of Mountains. Landslide deals that much damage to target player.
originalText: Sacrifice any number of mountains. Landslide deals that much damage to target player.
flavor:
Sometimes the mountain takes.
—Keldon saying

name: Lurking Jackals

rulings.text: Once it becomes a creature, it will not change back into an enchantment if your opponent's life total goes back above 10.
Once it becomes a creature, it is no longer an enchantment.

A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

text: When an opponent has 10 or less life, if Lurking Jackals is an enchantment, it becomes a 3/2 Hound creature.
originalText: When one of your opponents has 10 life or less, if Lurking Jackals is an enchantment, it becomes a 3/2 Hound creature.
flavor: Often it's not the hunter or the hunted but the opportunist who thrives in Rath.

name: Magnify
text: All creatures get +1/+1 until end of turn.
originalText: All creatures get +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor: The seed torches' pollen gives off light, but the elves find it heightens their senses as well.

text:
{2}: Mantis Engine gains flying until end of turn. (It can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
{2}: Mantis Engine gains first strike until end of turn. (It deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)

originalText:
{2}: Mantis Engine gains flying until end of turn.
{2}: Mantis Engine gains first strike until end of turn.

rulings.text: It only returns if it is still on the battlefield at end of turn.

Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has haste.

Enchanted creature gains haste. (It may attack and {T} the turn it comes under your control.) 
At end of turn, return Mark of Fury to its owner's hand.

When Marker Beetles dies, target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

Enchanted creature has protection from black and from red.

text: {T}: Prevent the next 4 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.

originalText: {T}: Prevent the next 4 damage to target creature or player this turn.

originalText: Destroy all enchantments. You gain 2 life for each enchantment destroyed this way.

text: {2}{B}, {T}: Reveal any number of black cards in your hand. Target creature gets -X/-X until end of turn, where X is the number of cards revealed this way.
originalText: {2}{B}, {T}: Reveal any number of black cards in your hand. Target creature gets -X/-X until end of turn, where X is the number of cards revealed this way.

rulings.text: You can reveal zero cards to give -0/-0 to a creature.

name: Opalescence

rulings.text: Does not animate itself. But can be animated by another Opalescence.

With a Humility and two Opalescences on the battlefield, if Humility has the latest timestamp, then all creatures are 1/1 with no abilities. If the timestamp order is Opalescence, Humility, Opalescence, the second Opalescence is 1/1, and the Humility and first Opalescence are 4/4. If Humility has the earliest timestamp, then everything is 4/4.

A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

This is the current interaction between Humility and Opalescence: The type-changing effect applies at layer 4, but the rest happens in the applicable layers. The rest of it will apply even if the permanent loses its ability before it's finished applying. So if Opalescence, Humility, and Worship are on the battlefield and Opalescence entered the battlefield before Humility, the following is true: Layer 4: Humility and Worship each become creatures that are still enchantments. (Opalescence). Layer 6: Humility and Worship each lose their abilities. (Humility) Layer 7b: Humility becomes 4/4 and Worship becomes 4/4. (Opalescence). Humility becomes 1/1 and Worship becomes 1/1 (Humility). But if Humility entered the battlefield before Opalescence, the following is true: Layer 4: Humility and Worship each become creatures that are still enchantments (Opalescence). Layer 6: Humility and Worship each lose their abilities (Humility). Layer 7b: Humility becomes 1/1 and Worship becomes 1/1 (Humility). Humility becomes 4/4 and Worship becomes 4/4 (Opalescence).

text: Each other non-Aura enchantment is a creature in addition to its other types and has base power and base toughness each equal to its converted mana cost.
originalText: Each other global enchantment is a creature with power and toughness each equal to its converted mana cost. It's still an enchantment.

name: Opposition
text: Tap an untapped creature you control: Tap target artifact, creature, or land.
originalText: Tap an untapped creature you control: Tap target artifact, creature, or land.
flavor:
"Urza says he's sane. Perhaps, but measures of sanity among planeswalkers are hard to come by."
—Barrin

name: Pattern of Rebirth

rulings.text: Searching for a creature card is optional. You can't go back and do it if you forget to do so, even if you normally do this.
Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

text:
Enchant creature
When enchanted creature dies, that creature's controller may search his or her library for a creature card and put that card onto the battlefield. If that player does, he or she shuffles his or her library.
originalText: When enchanted creature is put into a graveyard from play, that creature's controller may search his or her library for a creature card and put that card into play. If that player does, he or she then shuffles his or her library.

text: {B}: Regenerate Phyrexian Monitor.
flavor: Being one would be an honor, if the word "honor" had any meaning in Phyrexia.

text:
Trample
Whenever Phyrexian Negator is dealt damage, sacrifice that many permanents.

originalText:
Trample
Whenever Phyrexian Negator is dealt damage, sacrifice a permanent for each 1 damage dealt to it.

rulings.text: The owner decides the order the two lands are stacked there.

originalText: Put two target lands on top of their owner's library.

To renew the land, plow the land. To destroy the land, do nothing.

name: Powder Keg

rulings.text: Only destroys artifacts and creatures with exactly the specified cost. It does not mean "less than or equal to".
Putting on a counter is optional. If you forget, you can't go back later even if it is something you usually do.

text:

rulings.text: Putting on a counter is optional. If you forget, you can't go back later even if it is something you usually do.

name: Quash

rulings.text: It exiles the countered spell. This is because the first sentence puts the spell into the graveyard before you continue to the second sentence.
If the spell is not countered (because the spell it targets can't be countered), then it does not get exiled but all the other copies in the graveyard, hand, and library are exiled.
Quash can exile cards even if the spell countered was a copy of a spell. For example, if you Quash a Boomerang cast from an Isochron Scepter, you may search for and exile cards named Boomerang.

If Quash counters a spell that has had text spliced onto it, only the base spell may be exiled. For example, if you use Quash to counter a Kodama's Might with a Glacial Ray spliced onto it, you may search for and exile only Kodama's Might.
The copies must be found if they are in publicly viewable zones. Finding copies while searching private zones is optional.

text: Counter target instant or sorcery spell. Search its controller's graveyard, hand, and library for all cards with the same name as that spell and exile them. Then that player shuffles his or her library.
originalText: Counter target instant or sorcery spell. Search its controller's graveyard, hand, and library for all copies of that card and remove them from the game. That player then shuffles his or her library.

name: Rapid Decay

rulings.text: You pick the cards during announcement. If any are not there on resolution, any others that are there are still affected.

Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

text:
Exile up to three target cards from a single graveyard.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
originalText:
Cycling {2}
Remove from the game up to three target cards in a single graveyard.

text: When Ravenous Rats enters the battlefield, target opponent discards a card.

originalText: Whenever you or a permanent you control is the target of a spell or ability controlled by one of your opponents, you may draw a card, and if Rayne, Academy Chancellor is enchanted, you may draw another card.

rulings.text: If a spell or ability targets multiple permanents you control or targets you and one or more of your permanents, this triggers once for each such target.
The "if" in the card text does not have a special meaning. You check if this card is enchanted when the ability resolves and draw 1 or 2 cards.
When casting an Aura on this card, the triggered ability will resolve before the Aura enters the battlefield.

name: Reckless Abandon

rulings.text: You must sacrifice exactly one creature to cast this spell; you cannot cast it without sacrificing a creature, and you cannot sacrifice additional creatures.
Players can only respond once this spell has been cast and all its costs have been paid. No one can try to destroy the creature you sacrificed to prevent you from casting this spell.

text:
As an additional cost to cast Reckless Abandon, sacrifice a creature.
Reckless Abandon deals 4 damage to target creature or player.
originalText:
As an additional cost to play Reckless Abandon, sacrifice a creature.
Reckless Abandon deals 4 damage to target creature or player.

originalText: Whenever a creature is dealt damage, Repercussion deals that much damage to that creature's controller.

name: Replenish

rulings.text: It determines what enchantments to return when its resolution starts. If more enchantments go to the graveyard during the resolution, those additional enchantments are ignored.
You must return Auras if possible, even if this means enchanting an opponent's permanent with a good enchantment.

Auras can only be placed on permanents that were on the battlefield before this effect started to resolve. You can't put an enchantment onto the battlefield with Replenish and put an Aura that is also entering the battlefield onto one of those enchantments.

text: Return all enchantment cards from your graveyard to the battlefield. (Auras with nothing to enchant remain in your graveyard.)
originalText: Return all enchantment cards from your graveyard to play. (Local enchantments with no permanent to enchant remain in your graveyard.)

text: Return target permanent you control to its owner's hand.
originalText: Return target permanent you control to its owner's hand.

name: Scour

rulings.text: Does not exile other cards of the same name that are on the battlefield. Just from the graveyard, hand, and library.

Scour can target and exile cards that aren't always enchantments, but are enchantments when Scour is cast and resolves (such as creatures turned into enchantments by Soul Sculptor). Scour's exile effect only looks for cards by name, not type.
The copies must be found if they are in publicly viewable zones. Finding copies while searching private zones is optional.

text: Exile target enchantment. Search its controller's graveyard, hand, and library for all cards with the same name as that enchantment and exile them. Then that player shuffles his or her library.

text: {3}, {T}: Choose a number greater than 0 and a color. Target opponent reveals his or her hand. If that opponent reveals exactly the chosen number of cards of the chosen color, you draw a card.
originalText: {3}, {T}: Choose a number greater than 0 and a color. Target opponent reveals his or her hand. If that opponent reveals exactly the chosen number of cards of the chosen color, you draw a card.

name: Sowing Salt

rulings.text: Does not exile other cards of the same name that are on the battlefield. Just from the graveyard, hand, and library.
The copies must be found if they are in publicly viewable zones. Finding copies while searching private zones is optional.

text: Exile target nonbasic land. Search its controller's graveyard, hand, and library for all cards with the same name as that land and exile them. Then that player shuffles his or her library.
originalText: Remove target nonbasic land from the game. Search its controller's graveyard, hand, and library for all copies of that card and remove them from the game. That player then shuffles his or her library.

name: Splinter

rulings.text: Does not exile other cards of the same name that are on the battlefield. Just from the graveyard, hand, and library.

Splinter can target and exile cards that aren't always artifacts, but are artifacts when Splinter is cast and resolves (such as an animated Stalking Stones). Splinter's exile effect only looks for cards by name, not type.
The copies must be found if they are in publicly viewable zones. Finding copies while searching private zones is optional.

text: Exile target artifact. Search its controller's graveyard, hand, and library for all cards with the same name as that artifact and exile them. Then that player shuffles his or her library.
originalText: Remove target artifact from the game. Search its controller's graveyard, hand, and library for all copies of that card and remove them from the game. That player then shuffles his or her library.

text: Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
flavor: Only the coldest hearts and the strongest stomachs can stand against it.
originalText: Squirming Mass can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and black creatures.
name: Squirming Mass
Storage Matrix

rulings.text: This card's ability does not override effects which prevent a permanent from untapping.
Permanents with multiple types untap if any of their types is chosen. For example, an artifact creature untaps if either artifact or creature is chosen.

If another effect limits the number of permanents that untap, that number combines with Storage Matrix's effect. For example, Imi Statue says "players can't untap more than one artifact during their untap steps." If both Imi Statue and an untapped Storage Matrix are on the battlefield, and you choose "artifact," only one artifact untaps.

text: As long as Storage Matrix is untapped, each player chooses artifact, creature, or land during his or her untap step. That player can untap only permanents of the chosen type this step.
originalText: As long as Storage Matrix is untapped, instead of each player untapping the permanents he or she controls during his or her untap step, that player chooses artifacts, creatures, or lands and untaps all permanents of the chosen type he or she controls.

text: All creatures able to block Taunting Elf do so.
flavor: Much to Multani's chagrin, Rofellos gleefully tutored Yavimaya's elves on the rudest and most vulgar words spoken in Llanowar.
originalText: All creatures able to block Taunting Elf do so.
name: Taunting Elf

text: When Telepathic Spies enters the battlefield, look at target opponent's hand.
flavor: "Do try to keep an open mind, would you?"
originalText: When Telepathic Spies comes into play, look at target opponent's hand.

"Of course she's at the head of her class. All her classmates have disappeared."
—Gatha, Tolarian renegade
originalText: {U}{U}{U}, {T}: Return target permanent to its owner's hand.

text:
Flying
When you control no enchantments, sacrifice Tethered Griffin.
flavor: Poorly trained griffins sometimes attack the noble audiences that gather to watch their progress.

Flying
When you control no enchantments, sacrifice Tethered Griffin.
name: Tethered Griffin

rulings.text: The ability will trigger if you don't control an enchantment, even for a brief moment during the resolution of another spell or ability.
Only checks if you control no enchantments at the time it triggers. It does not check again on resolution. Gaining control of an enchantment before then will not save the Griffin.

text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Whenever Thieving Magpie deals damage to an opponent, draw a card.
flavor: Rayne once made several unkind comparisons between the bird's naked opportunism and Urza's.
originalText:
Flying 
Whenever Thieving Magpie deals damage to one of your opponents, you draw a card.
name: Thieving Magpie

text: You may have Thorn Elemental assign its combat damage as though it weren't blocked.
flavor: Rain from this storm leaves you pinned to the ground like an insect.
originalText: Thorn Elemental may deal its combat damage to defending player as though it weren't blocked.
name: Thorn Elemental

rulings.text: If this creature is attacking a planeswalker, assigning its damage as though it weren't blocked means the damage is assigned to the planeswalker, not to the defending player.

When assigning combat damage, you choose whether you want to assign all damage to blocking creatures, or if you want to assign all of it to the defending player or planeswalker. You can't split the damage assignment between them.
You can decide to assign damage to the defending player or planeswalker even if the blocking creature has protection from green or damage preventing effects on it.
If blocked by a creature with banding, the defending player decides whether or not the damage is assigned "as though it weren't blocked".

name: Thran Dynamo
text: {T}: Add {3} to your mana pool.
originalText: {T}: Add three colorless mana to your mana pool.
flavor: Urza's metathran children were conceived, birthed, and nurtured by an integrated system of machines.

name: Thran Foundry
text: {1}, {T}, Exile Thran Foundry: Target player shuffles his or her graveyard into his or her library.
originalText: {1}, {T}, Remove Thran Foundry from the game: Target player shuffles his or her graveyard into his or her library.
flavor:

originalText:
When Treachery comes into play, untap up to five lands.
You control enchanted creature.
name: Treachery

rulings.text: You can untap 0 to 5 lands.
You can untap another player's lands.
This does not target the lands.

name: Trumpet Blast

rulings.text: An "attacking creature" is one that has been declared as an attacker this combat, or one that was put onto the battlefield attacking this combat. Unless that creature leaves combat, it continues to be an attacking creature through the end of combat step, even if the player it was attacking has left the game, or the planeswalker it was attacking has left combat.
Even though Trumpet Blast affects only attacking creatures, the bonus will remain for the rest of the turn.
Only creatures that are attacking as Trumpet Blast resolves will receive the bonus. In other words, casting it before you’ve declared attackers usually won’t do anything.

text: Attacking creatures get +2/+0 until end of turn.
originalText: Attacking creatures get +2/+0 until end of turn.
flavor: Keldon warriors don't need signals to tell them when to attack, but when to stop.

name: Twisted Experiment
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +3/-1.
originalText: Enchanted creature gets +3/-1.
flavor: Gatha showed remarkable prowess in increasing his subjects' stature. Their lifespans, however, were another matter.

name: Urza's Incubator

rulings.text: Multiple Incubators are cumulative.
You choose a creature type right as it enters the battlefield, before any continuous effects are applied or trigged abilities trigger.

text:
As Urza's Incubator enters the battlefield, choose a creature type.
Creature spells of the chosen type cost {2} less to cast.
originalText:
When Urza's Incubator comes into play, choose a creature type.

flavor:
"Stop thinking like an artificer, Urza, and start thinking like a father!"

rulings.text: Only looks at the card name, so it will not destroy lands that just share the destroyed land's type.

Mountains leveled, forests felled—
